The severely worn belt slid and rubbed against the return idler at the ignition point, generating high temperature and sparks, which ignited the powdered coal accumulated in the hole of the return idler. The operator of the belt conveyor noticed the abnormal situation of the belt and called the ground centralized control center to stop the belt. After the emergency stop, the stationary belt was ignited. Due to the unqualified fire - retardant performance of the belt, the large - inclination roadway, and the upward ventilation, the fire intensified, causing the belt and coal to burn together.
